intro: Stemodia capitata, commonly known as the clustered stemodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems that often form dense clusters. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in compact inflorescences at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. Stemodia capitata is often found in grassy areas and is adapted to thrive in full sun with well-drained soil.
